I am a researcher who loves building novel signal processing systems using deep learning.
I would like to continue my research in the field of autonomous driving by combining the knowledge of Self-Driving Car Engineer learned at Udacity with my experience of radar system development.
Previously, my lifelong fascination with artificial intelligence and radar led me to become an innovator in research on computer vision for automatic target recognition (ATR) of synthetic aperture radar (SAR).

content:
CARLA is an open-source simulator for autonomous driving research developed by Computer Vision Center (CVC) at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona.
The software is available on GitHub, the documentation is available on Read the Docs.
Epic Games’s Unreal Engine 4 is used as a game engine.
It currently has integration with Autoware Fundation’s Autoware.AI using ROS bridge for CARLA simulator.
summary: An open-source simulator for autonomous driving research developed by Computer Vision Center at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona
title: CARLA

content:
LGSVL Simulator is an autonomous vehicle simulator developed by LG Electronics Silicon Valley Lab (LGSVL).
The software is available on GitHub, the documentation is available on Web.
Unity Technologies’s Unity is used as a game engine.
It currently has integration with Baidu’s Apollo (LGSVL fork) and Autoware Fundation’s Autoware.
summary: An autonomous vehicle simulator developed by LG Electronics Silicon Valley Lab (LGSVL)
title: LGSVL Simulator

content:
Autoware is an autonomous driving software developed by Autoware Fundation.
There are three projects: Autoware.AI, Autoware.IO, and Autoware.Auto.
Autoware.AI built on ROS 1 is available on Gitlab, Autoware.Auto built on ROS 2 is also available on Gitlab.
summary: An autonomous driving software developed by Autoware Fundation
title: Autoware

content:
Apollo is an open autonomous driving platform developed by Baidu.
The open software platform is available on Github.
The latest release is Apollo 5.5.
The latest release tag is apollo-v5.5.0. In addition to the tag, there is r5.5.0 branch. The branch continues to make changes for Apollo 5.5.
Apollo 3.5 and later, instead of the Apollo ROS, has been used Apollo Cyber RT.
Caffe is used as a deep learning framework for the perception module. Since Apollo 5.0, Baidu’s PaddlePaddle (PArallel Distributed Deep LEarning) is also supported.
summary: An open autonomous driving platform developed by Baidu
title: Apollo

summary: We propose a new convolutional neural network (CNN) which performs coarse and fine segmentation for end-to-end synthetic aperture radar (SAR) automatic target recognition (ATR) system.
title: SAVERS: SAR ATR with Verification Support Based on Convolutional Neural Network

summary: The standard architecture of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) automatic target recognition (ATR) consists of three stages: detection, discrimination, and classification. In this report, we propose a novel convolutional neural network (CNN) for end-to-end ATR from SAR imagery.
title: Deep Learning for End-to-End Automatic Target Recognition from Synthetic Aperture Radar Imagery

summary: This report deals with translation invariance of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for automatic target recognition (ATR) from synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imagery. In particular, the translation invariance of CNNs for SAR ATR represents the robustness against misalignment of target chips extracted from SAR images.
title: Deep Learning for Target Classification from SAR Imagery: Data Augmentation and Translation Invariance
